title: Will Trade #1 SGC T205 Master Set For 1-2 Rare / High End Pre-War Graded Cards
author: Matt E.

posts.post_title: Will Trade #1 SGC T205 Master Set For 1-2 Rare / High End Pre-War Graded Cards
posts.post_content:
The thread I started recently about the “largest trade you ever made” got me thinking about the trade value of the T205 set I have built. It is currently the number one T205 Master Set on the SGC Registry. I figured with National coming up next month in Cleveland, it would be an easy task to bring it to the show if someone was interested in trading. I live two hours away.

I am ready to move on to a different collecting interest and looking to trade for 1- 2 prewar cards preferably graded by SGC of equal value.  With all the public auction sales information, Ebay and of course our own BST, I will let you gather what you determine the value is on your side, so I will respectfully not post my “trade value” here today. Trust me I have a number.

I will say it is missing only the elusive “Hoblitzell No Stats” and has the only one of a kind T205 Eddie Collins “Yellow Elephant” in the hobby. In my opinion, there are 15-20 cards that could receive a bump if the new owner so desires to send them in.

I am not looking to sell, dump it to get money, nor am I desperate to break it up either. I am looking to offer someone a once in a life-time opportunity card to own a T205 Master Set and I will receive what I never could have purchased when I started collecting in 2001…. a rare high grade prewar card beyond my wildest expectations. 

Confidentiality is important and would like for any contacts to be made through my email, [url]mattengle61@gmail.com[/url]. 

You may view the set at my imageevent website, [url]http://www.imageevent.com/babybingbaseball[/url], scroll down to number 4.

Other helpful information
[url]http://sgccard.com/usersetcomposition.aspx?id=0&usersetid=1818[/url]

Thanks,

Matt E.
Boy does that set have me drooling.  I have nothing to offer however.  Good luck.

Appreciate the nice comment. 

Thanks,

Matt E.
If you do happen to make this trade I would love to hear what you end up with. Good luck!
That really is a beautiful set.  :)
Isn't Sean looking for this set?  I think he pays the highest prices out there. May want to contact him.
Nice set! Good luck with the trade.
I can watch that slideshow all day. Great master set.

Matt you have an amazing set. Turner and yourself have done a great job with it.  Sad to see you stepping away from the set.  

Did you mean you have the nicest example of the Collins Yellow Elephant or the only one?

quite a top shelf accomplishment.
hold onto it 'til something absolutely breathtaking makes you unequivocally know that it's tradin' time.  

all the best,
barry
